title: Reflection - shallow box made from mirrors 1 2 3

content.question: Three mirrors, <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, are joined at right angles to make a shallow box, as shown in the figure. A beam of light is incident on Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> at an angle of incidence <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is less than <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math>. After reflecting off of Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the beam then reflects off of Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and finally reflects off of Mirror <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the angles of reflection <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="theta sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> for the beam relative to mirrors <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="theta sub 1, equals theta sub 2, which equals theta sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, theta sub 1, equals theta sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="theta sub 2, is greater than open parenthesis, theta sub 1, equals theta sub 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="theta sub 3, is greater than theta sub 2, which is greater than theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="theta sub 2, is greater than open parenthesis, theta sub 1, equals theta sub 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
